args:
The Imperial Army is led by Captain Harle,
who sends the giant fiend Hypnos after the
prince and his allies. Since the fiend's true
form exists in the space between worlds,
the heroes are forced to enter this no-man's
land in order to fight their decisive battle.
We did it! Did you see that?! Wooo!
They are dropped by extremely strong foes,\nand contain unusual amounts of power.
With the mana inside, one can warp the \nvery fabric of space itself.
Well, in that case, let's take it with us!\nWe should be able to find a use for\nsomething like that.
The village is just over there.\nPlease hurry, everyone!
Right. Let's make sure Sylvia is okay.
Gah! The prince and his lackeys are here!
Oy, stop quakin' in yer boots already.\nWe got...THAT! Remember?!
Well, that can't possibly be goo—WHOA!
Okay, I don't wanna panic anyone or\nanything, but PAAAAANIIIIIIC!
I didn't even know they MADE fiends\nthis big!
Uh oh. That's one heck of a wind.\nI'm gonna get blown away!
You're not the only one in such danger!
Just hang in there, everyone! We'll get our\nchance to move—I'm sure of it!
An attack of this intensity will take an\nequal amount of mana. The fiend has\nto run out eventually!
And then we move, yeah? Got it!
That was...incredible. I can't believe we\nwere victorious against such a monster!
We might even be strong enough to...\nNo. We MUST be that strong.
At this rate, you might even be able\nto defeat...HIM, {player_name}.

My, my. That WAS splendid! Though
perhaps I should have expected as
much from the traitor prince and
his merry band.
Ah, but it is! It's been quite some time,\n{player_name}.
Melsa? Why do you look so scared?
Don't be afraid of that smirking jerk!
We smacked him down the last time he\nshowed, and we'll do the same here!
...Ain't that right, Harle? Or did we hit you\nso hard that you forgot?
Oh, and we whupped your little pawn\ntoday, too. So how's about you tuck your\ntail between your legs and beat it?!
Now THIS is amusing. You act as though\nyou've already won the day!
We DID win, chump! Now make like\nlightning and bolt before we mop the\nfloor with your face.
Heh. If you are truly so foolish,\nthen perhaps the time has come\nto show you.
Hypnos! Come forth once more from the\nspace between worlds!
Oh, come ON! That thing again?!
Yeah, this thing was definitely dead.
Ah, what delightful panic on your faces!\nHow I have yearned to see this!
Now let me explain our little trick to you,\nso that I might see your panic change to\nutter despair.
The Hypnos before you is but a shadow of\nthe real thing. A copy, you might say.
The true body exists beyond this place—\nin the space between worlds!
But that's... That shouldn't be possible.
Aaaaah ha ha ha! Your fear is delicious!\nHow does it feel to know that you cannot\npossibly stand against your foe?!
This guy is really getting on my nerves.
Wait, Luca! Remember the otherworld\nfragment we picked up earlier?
If we use its power to distort space...
Oh ho! Then you have a means to stand\nagainst the true Hypnos, do you? Well,\nthat will be great fun as well.
Still, you should know that the copy's\nstrength is nothing compared to that\nof the foe you plan to face!
I cannot wait to see you all gibbering on\nthe ground in utter defeat!
That's right! If we can take it on face-to-\nface, we've got a great chance to win!
Ain't met a fiend yet what I can't kill.\nNo reason this one's any different.
You may leave the fore to me.\nWe shall win the day for certain!
Fight with all you've got, everyone.\nI'll keep you healed.
I don't understand. Anyone else would\nhave surrendered by now.
But we're not anyone else—we all\nbelieve in {player_name}.
Don't just believe in me, Melsa.\nBelieve in all of us!

I'm sure your feelings have crossed
worlds and reached places far, far
away—touching more people than
you can possibly know.
